required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Photon/Proton Radiation Therapy for Carcinoma of the Skin of the Head and Neck
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Outcomes Protocol of Photon/Proton Beam Radiation Therapy for Carcinoma of the Skin of the Head and Neck With Perineural Invasion

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect information from the questionnaire and your medical records to see what effects the proton radiation has on you and your cancer and collect and analyze morbidity outcomes: Incidence of xerostomia (dry mouth) and tumor control.

detailed_description.textblock: Data collection will be obtained from the patient's medical records including initial evaluation, pathology report, dosimetry information, radiotherapy completion records and follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Collect and analyze morbidity outcomes: Incidence of grade 3 or higher xerostomia (dry mouth)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year following the completion of radiation therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Collect and analyze tumor control outcomes.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: When each patient has been followed for a minimum of 6 months and then again at 24 months.

clinical_study.condition: Malignant Neoplasm of Skin Head and Neck

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated at radiation oncology clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Carcinoma of the skin of the head and neck region with incidental or symptomatic perineural invasion.
- Biopsy-proven squamous cell carcinoma.
- Will receive treatment with proton radiation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of distant metastasis.
- Previous irradiation for head and neck cancer.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

facility.name: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

link.description: Contact the University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute
